definition: lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 蛇[she2]
snake/serpent/CL:條|条[tiao2]
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: A lot of Olympick projects of China is anti-climax.
sentences.chinese: 中国好多奥运会的项目是虎头蛇尾。

sentences.english: After the fine performance in the first act, the rest of the play was an anticlimax.
sentences.chinese: 后性能优良的第一幕，其余的发挥是一个虎头蛇尾。

sentences.english: It's just very depressing and anticlimactic.
sentences.chinese: 电影非常令人沮丧而且还虎头蛇尾的。

sentences.english: Every year, Yao Ming is difficult to Savior, the Rockets are doing it by halves of the kind of counseling.
sentences.chinese: 每一年，姚明都以难救主，火箭都是虎头蛇尾的怂样。

sentences.english: In fact, contraction is a cop-out.

definition: to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
dilatory/sluggish/muddled/roundabout
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to procrastinate
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
to work vaguely then retreat (idiom); sloppy and half-hearted/half-baked
dragging one's feet
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
lit. dragon's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
banging away clumsily in all directions with no overall vision
pinyin: dong1 yi1 lang2 tou2 xi1 yi1 bang4 zi5

definition: to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it

definition: lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
